items: Anomalous origin of the coronary arteries

blocks.text: Plaque burden grading: 2016: No systematic classification. 2022: New plaque burden grading P1-P4.
CT-FFR can clarify hemodynamic significance for stenosis 50-90% (especially CAD-RADS 3 and 4A); consider for proximal lesions >=40% with HRP features.

rows:
- CAD-RADS 3 or 4/I+ with lesion-specific CT-FFR <=0.75.
- Consider ICA for individuals likely to benefit from revascularization.

- CAD-RADS 3 or 4/I- with lesion-specific CT-FFR >0.80.
- Distal value <=0.80 not linked to a specific stenosis: defer invasive angiography; optimize medical therapy.

- CAD-RADS 3 or 4/I+/- with borderline, grey-zone CT-FFR 0.76-0.80.
- Consider invasive angiography based on symptoms, lesion location, and trans-lesional pressure loss; consider revascularization for likely benefit.

blocks.text: Applies to CAD-RADS 3 and 4A (and select proximal >=40% with HRP).

rows: Myocardial ischemia in a defined coronary territory (CAD-RADS 3 or 4/I+).
Myocardial infarct or no ischemia in a defined territory (CAD-RADS 3 or 4/I-).
Peri-infarct ischemia in a defined coronary territory (CAD-RADS 3 or 4/I+).

items: I+ = ischemia; I- = no lesion-specific ischemia; I+/- = borderline (0.76-0.80).
Consider ICA for high-grade stenosis (>90%), HRP, or concordant ischemia on CT-FFR/CTP.
Trans-lesional pressure loss >0.12 (1-2 cm proximal to stenosis; CT-FFR 1-2 cm distal) suggests significance in borderline cases.
